stages.logText: I met Miri in the Crossroads Guardhouse.
Since I had helped Ailshara, she wouldn't tell me about Andor. (1 XP) [End of quest]
Since I had hid the truth on the bootlegging of beer from Sullengard, she wouldn't tell me about Andor. (1 XP) [End of quest]
Since I had aided Feyguard once or twice earlier, she would tell me about Andor, after I had completed a detection for her.
Since Miri was poisoned by slitherers near Sullengard, and healing is taking time, she wanted me to investigate something bad in the  blue hills in the weird areas to the South of Stoutford.
I went to the area to the South of Stoutford, and encountered an impassable force shield there.
There was a piece of Kazaul Ritual there, which I had encountered before.  I had to inform Miri.
Miri asked me where I had seen this before.  I told her about a task I had carried out on behalf of Throdna.
Miri told me to meet him and enquire further.  And gave me a phrase whenever he started rambling.
Throdna told me it was part of a ritual to break the barrier which forms when one does a ritual to call strong Kazaul monsters.
The ritual consisted of two parts which I had found earlier, and a chant in a book called Calomyran Secrets. I needed to report this to Miri.
I told Miri about finding the book for an Old Man in Fallhaven.  She told me to talk to him.
The Old Man would not let me borrow the book, so I started noting the chant in front of him.
The book contained half the chant. The rest was to be found in another book Azimyran Secrets.
Miri told me she'd trace the book. She told me to await her and take a nap.
Miri returned, and told me that the book Azimyran Secrets was with an Old Hermit near Arulir mountains.
I met the Old Hermit and asked him about the book, Azimyran Secrets.
He refused to give it to me, so I copied the chant sitting with him. I needed to tell Miri.
Miri told me to hurry and pass the barrier.
Beyond the barrier, after finding terrible monsters, I found a Mourning Woman performing a ritual. She thought it would bring her husband back to life. I destroyed the ritual statue of Kazaul.
Miri, who followed me, convinced the woman that it was actually an evil ritual to overrun Dhayavar with Kazaul's monsters.
The Mourning Woman told us that the ritual was given to her by a priest who walks on lava east of the blue hills.
We let the Mourning Woman go.
I had to travel to the lava wastelands.
There, after fighting monsters, I met a priest in red.
He accused me of interfering again and again. Miri, who again followed me unmasked him to be a monster.
I defeated the monster.
Miri told me that she had promised to tell me where Andor was. He was buying food supplies from Rosmara.
I ran to Rosmara's shop.
I found Andor there.
He told me he couldn't come home now, and teleported away.
I had to go searching for Andor again.
end
